New Records: Mitchell Marsh scored the second-highest individual score of the World Cup, finishing unbeaten on 177 off 132 balls
Australia completed their biggest chase in World Cups, reaching 307 to win by 8 wickets
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh and Steven Smith formed a 102-run stand off 92 balls for the second wicket
Mitchell Marsh batted aggressively despite cramps, hitting 17 fours and nine sixes
Australia won by 8 wickets with 32 balls remaining
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's strategy involved focusing on their batting order and preparing for the semi-finals
Bangladesh's batting effort was strong, with key partnerships and individual contributions
Steven Smith's return to the team was significant after missing the last game
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh expressed satisfaction with his performance despite cramps
David Warner hinted at his retirement from T20Is after the match
Bangladesh's campaign ended on a high note but fell short of their goal
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under favorable conditions for batting
Bangladesh's highest total in the World Cup was 306, setting up a competitive chase
Mitchell Marsh and Steven Smith's performances were pivotal to Australia's win
Others: The pitch was good for batting, supporting high scores and aggressive batting
Marnus Labuschagne's fielding was exceptional, contributing to key dismissals
The match was closely followed by fans and experts, with significant implications for the World Cup standings
